summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 regarding a complainant in Amsterdam who wants to provide information to the FBI about the Jeffrey Epstein case. It involves FBI personnel from the New York Field Office, the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, and the FBI's office in The Hague coordinating to connect the complainant with the appropriate case agent, potentially requiring an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email chain is about a complainant wanting to provide information regarding 'the Jeffrey Epstein case' to the FBI.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Addressed in the email as the person who can help connect the NY case agent with the Assistant Legal Attaché (ALAT).

connections.description: Mike, as an FBI recipient, is involved in coordinating the connection of a case agent for the Epstein investigation based on a new complainant.

events.title: Complainant comes forward in Amsterdam
events.description: A complainant in Amsterdam contacted the FBI via the RSO (Regional Security Officer) wanting to provide information about the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: FBI email coordination for interview
events.description: FBI personnel from New York and The Hague coordinate via email to connect the complainant with the NY case agent for an interview, potentially requiring an MLAT.

keyFacts: In April 2021, a complainant in Amsterdam approached the FBI wanting to provide information about the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The FBI's Assistant Legal Attaché in The Hague initiated coordination with the FBI's New York Field Office and Child Exploitation units to arrange an interview.
The coordination suggests the potential use of an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) to facilitate the interview with the complainant.
The email chain indicates ongoing FBI investigative interest in the Epstein case as of 2021.
